business.headline: Titan share price falls 3% after disappointing Q2 results. Buy or sell?At 11:15 am, shares of Titan were down 2.80% at Rs 3,142.50 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

Sensex, Nifty tumble ahead of US elections; Hero MotoCorp falls 4%The NSE Nifty 50 dropped by 321.20 points to settle at 23,983.15, while the BSE Sensex fell 941.88 points to 78,782.24. Most of the broader market indices also declined sharply during the session.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Donald Trump smells win, takes 2 swing states, Kamala Harris skips speechUS Election Result 2024: Republican Donald Trump takes a strong lead with projected wins in 25 states, securing 246 electoral votes. Vice President Kamala Harris is hot on his heels with 210 electoral votes as the results roll in.

Live: Trump wins Pennsylvania, projects Fox News, 3 electoral votes away presidencyUS Presidential Election Result Live Updates: Kamala Harris and Donald Trump, the two contenders for the 2024 US presidential election, wrapped up their electoral campaigns on Monday night, paving the way for Americans to cast their ballots in one of the most anticipated polls in the country. While Trump, the Republican contender, is attempting to win a second stint at the White House, Harris -- the incumbent Vice President and Democratic nominee -- is vying to create history by becoming first female President of the US. The 7 battleground states of Arizona, Nevada, Georgia, North Carolina, Wisconsin, Michigan and Pennsylvania will play a key role in deciding the fate of Harris and Trump. The two will need at least 270 electoral votes to win the presidency. Voting began at 4.30 pm (IST) on Tuesday and will continue until around 6.30 am (IST) on Wednesday morning. Follow indiatoday.in for live updates on the presidential election.

'You won't hear from Vice President tonight': Harris skips speech as hopes dimUS election results 2024: With projections showing Kamala Harris trailing, the mood among students, faculty and alumni at Howard University became sombre.
Let that sink in: Elon Musk recalls Twitter takeover moment with White House twistLet that sink in: Trump fan Elon Musk as Republican takes big lead

Not India but Indiana. Why US polls are sounding like an Indian electionFrom democracy khatre me to doubts over EVMs to fears over illegal immigrants and citizenship, the 2024 US presidential election is sounding very similar to a general election in India. There are uncanny similarities as the third rock from Sun shrinks in global issues.

Republicans seize control of US Senate for first time in four yearsThe unexpected battleground of Nebraska pushed Republicans over the top. Incumbent Republican Senator Deb Fischer brushed back a surprisingly strong challenge from independent newcomer Dan Osborn.

All over for Harris? '300 paar' for Trump if he holds on to leads in these statesUS election results: In the US presidential election, 270 electoral college votes are required to win the White House race. As per Associated Press trends, Trump is leading in five swing states.

Game set, match: Elon Musk as Trump leads Harris in White House raceTesla CEO and US billionaire Elon Musk has exuded confidence of Donald Trump's win in the US Presidential polls, as the early projections showed him ahead of Kamala Harris.

Sathyabama's RISE - Building a Stronger FutureSathyabama Institute of Science and Technology stands out as a beacon of educational excellence and social responsibility. Under the visionary leadership of Chancellor Dr. Mariazeena Johnson, this institution is redefining what it means to be a premier university in India, transforming lives through both world-class education and impactful community initiatives.

Kamala Harris wins Golden State California that has maximum electoral college votesDonald Trump is currently ahead in the US Presidential polls. He is leading with 230 electoral votes, as per early projections, while Kamala Harris has 179 electoral votes to her name.

Pennsylvania Result Live: Donald Trump projected to win key swing statePennsylvania Election Results 2024: After trailing Kamala Harris in early trends in Pennsylvania, Republican Donald Trump pulled ahead of her, maintaining his narrow lead over the Democratic candidate with most of the ballots counted. With 19 electoral votes, Pennsylvania becomes the critical battleground for Trump and Harris. This Rust Belt seat is the largest and most hotly contested of the swing states, pivotal for both candidates' paths to the White House. Trump's return campaign has focused on revitalising his 2016 strategies that secured wins in key states, while Harris has aimed to solidify the Democratic stronghold established by President Joe Biden in 2020. As the nation watches closely for the outcome, stay tuned to IndiaToday.in as we bring all the latest from Pennsylvania.

How Indian Railways is pushing to stay on top of festive season rushWith 65 per cent more special trains scheduled than last year, October was hectic; the next challenge: the swarm of post-Diwali and Chhath returnees

Ballot measure to overturn abortion ban rejected in Florida, passed in 3 statesThe Florida measure failed to clear the required 60% voter approval threshold to pass constitutional amendments in Florida. Most states require a simple majority.

Donald Trump wins North Carolina, first of seven swing statesNorth Carolina Election Result 2024 Live Updates: The 2024 presidential election in North Carolina has been a highly anticipated contest between Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump and Democratic nominee Kamala Harris. As a pivotal battleground state with 16 electoral votes, North Carolina's outcome is crucial in influencing the overall election results. Trump's campaign has centred on the economy, immigration, and crime, while Harris has emphasised strengthening the care economy, protecting abortion rights, and defending democratic values. Stay tuned for more updates on IndiaToday.in.

Amid US election, Americans were readying for second Civil WarMany Americans feared a second Civil War if Donald Trump, the Republican candidate, lost the 2024 US presidential election. Thousands were preparing for it and created 'survivalist retreats'. Indicating the chance of violence, pro-Trump far-right groups said they were "prepared to do what it takes".

Jeddah to host IPL 2025 auction on November 24 and 25 after late venue changeAfter a last-minute venue change, the Saudi Arabian city Jeddah has been chosen to host the Indian Premier League 2025 mega auction. The much-anticipated auction will be held on November 24 and 25.

Imane Khelif gender row reignited. Navratilova reacts to 'leaked medical report'Media reports alleged that Algerian boxer Imane Khelif, a Paris Olympics champion, is biologically male based on leaked medical findings. The reports claim Khelif possesses XY chromosomes and male anatomical characteristics, sparking renewed debate about her eligibility to compete in women's boxing.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
